Package com.deliburd.extrataskschedulers

Class StealingCallbackFutureTask<V>

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.concurrent.FutureTask<V>
      • com.deliburd.extrataskschedulers.StealingCallbackFutureTask<V>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    CallbackFuture<V>, StealingCallbackFuture<V>, StealingFuture<V>, Runnable, Future<V>, RunnableFuture<V>
    public final class StealingCallbackFutureTask<V>
extends FutureTask<V>
implements StealingCallbackFuture<V>
    A FutureTask that can do work in the executor linked to it if one is provided and can have work stolen from it while waiting for a computation's result. Callbacks can also be added that execute after completion of a callback whether it be due to success, failure, or cancellation. An optional Consumer can be provided which runs when a callback fails. Exceptions that come from the provided consumer will cause it to silently fail.
    Author:
    DELIBURD

    • Constructor Detail

      • StealingCallbackFutureTask

        public StealingCallbackFutureTask​(Callable<V> callable)
        Creates a StealingCallbackFutureTask which will execute the provided callable when it's run, providing its returned value to threads waiting after execution. This task will have no executor linked to it or a consumer to run when a callback fails.
        Parameters:
        callable - The Callable that can be run.

      • StealingCallbackFutureTask

        runnable - The Runnable that can be run.
        value - The value to provide to waiting threads after the computation is done.

                                  StealingCallbackExecutor executor)

        Parameters:
        callable - The Callable that can be run.
        executor - The StealingCallbackExecutor to link to this object. This can be null to not link one.

    • Method Detail

      • done

        protected void done()
        Protected method invoked when this task transitions to state isDone (whether normally or via cancellation). This method should be called by subclasses overriding this method. Subclasses may override this method to invoke completion callbacks or perform bookkeeping. Note that you can query status inside the implementation of this method to determine whether this task has been cancelled.
        Overrides:
        done in class FutureTask<V>

      • stealingGet

        public V stealingGet()
              throws InterruptedException,
                     ExecutionException
        Description copied from interface: StealingFuture
        Retrieves the results of the computation for this future when they're available. Unlike Future.get, if the computation has not finished yet, this method checks if the executor linked to this future can have work stolen from it and there are tasks available that this thread can do from the linked executor and starts executing them if these conditions are met. If the executor cannot have work stolen from it or no executor is linked, then this method will act just like Future.get. If there is a linked executor but there are no tasks this thread can execute, it will block for a certain amount of time, checking if the computation has a result. If it does, then this method returns. Otherwise, it repeats the process.

        Because this method can execute work from the linked executor, the results aren't retrieved as soon as they're available. Callers of this method should keep this in mind if a result is needed as soon as its available.

        Specified by:
        stealingGet in interface StealingFuture<V>
        Returns:
        The value retrieved from the computation.
        Throws:
        InterruptedException - If the thread was interrupted while waiting when there were no tasks in the queue.
        ExecutionException - If the computation threw an exception while it was being completed.

      • stealingGet

        public V stealingGet​(long timeout,
                     TimeUnit unit)
              throws InterruptedException,
                     ExecutionException,
                     TimeoutException
        Description copied from interface: StealingFuture
        Retrieves the results of the computation for this future when they're available, throwing an exception if the timeout was exceeded and the computation hadn't finished. Unlike Future.get(long timeout, TimeUnit unit), , if the computation has not finished yet, this method checks if the executor linked to this future can have work stolen from it and there are tasks available that this thread can do from the linked executor and starts executing them if these conditions are met. If this object has no linked executor or the executor cannot have work stolen from it, this method will act just like Future.get(long timeout, TimeUnit unit). If there is a linked executor but there are no tasks this thread can execute, it will block for a certain amount of time, checking if the computation has a result or the timeout has been exceeded. If it completed successfully, then this method returns. If not, then this process repeats. If the timeout is exceeded when checked and the computation has not been completed yet, it will throw a TimeoutException.

        Because this method can execute work from the linked executor, the results aren't retrieved as soon as they're available. In addition, this method can only guarantee that at least the specified amount of time passes before throwing a TimeoutException, but will not not necessarily throw it as soon as the timeout passes. Callers of this method should keep this in mind if a result is needed as soon as its available or the method needs to exit as soon as the timeout passes.

        Specified by:
        stealingGet in interface StealingFuture<V>
        Parameters:
        timeout - The timeout to wait before throwing a TimeoutException. This must be larger than 0.
        unit - The time unit for the timeout specified.
        Returns:
        The value retrieved from the computation.
        Throws:
        InterruptedException - If the thread was interrupted while waiting when there were no tasks in the queue.
        ExecutionException - If the computation threw an exception while it was being completed.
        TimeoutException - If the timeout time was passed.

      • addSuccessCallback

        public void addSuccessCallback​(Consumer<? super V> onSuccess)
        Description copied from interface: CallbackFuture
        Adds a callback to run on success from the thread that executed the computation. If the computation has already been completed and was successful, the callback runs immediately on the thread calling this method. The callback should not block or be time-consuming to execute because all other callbacks added before execution or being added during execution could be delayed. Exceptions thrown from the callback will not affect execution of other callbacks.
        Specified by:
        addSuccessCallback in interface CallbackFuture<V>
        Parameters:
        onSuccess - The callback to run on success, providing the value of the CallbackFuture.

      • addFailureCallback

        public void addFailureCallback​(Consumer<? super Throwable> onFailure)
        Description copied from interface: CallbackFuture
        Adds a callback to run on failure from the thread that executed the computation. If the computation has already been completed and failed, the callback runs immediately on the thread calling this method. The callback should not block or be time-consuming to execute because all other callbacks added before execution or being added during execution could be delayed. Exceptions thrown from the callback will not affect execution of other callbacks.
        Specified by:
        addFailureCallback in interface CallbackFuture<V>
        Parameters:
        onFailure - The callback to run on failure, providing the value of the Throwable that caused the failure.

      • addCancellationCallback

        public void addCancellationCallback​(Runnable onCancellation)
        Description copied from interface: CallbackFuture
        Adds a callback to run on cancellation from the thread that cancelled the computation. If the computation was already cancelled, the callback runs immediately on the thread calling this method. The callback should not block or be time-consuming to execute because all other callbacks added before execution or being added during execution could be delayed. Exceptions thrown from the callback will not affect execution of other callbacks.
        Specified by:
        addCancellationCallback in interface CallbackFuture<V>
        Parameters:
        onCancellation - The callback to run on cancellation.

      • addSuccessCallback

        public void addSuccessCallback​(BiConsumer<StealingCallbackExecutor,​? super V> onSuccess)
        Description copied from interface: StealingCallbackFuture
        Adds a callback to run on success from the thread that executed the computation. If the computation has already been completed and was successful, the callback runs immediately on the thread calling this method. The callback should not block or be time-consuming to execute because all other callbacks added before execution or being added during execution could be delayed. Exceptions thrown from the callback will be printed to System.err, but will not affect execution of other callbacks. (add logging options?)
        Specified by:
        addSuccessCallback in interface StealingCallbackFuture<V>
        Parameters:
        onSuccess - The callback to run on success, providing the linked StealingCallbackExecutor and the value of the StealingCallbackFuture.

        Description copied from interface: StealingCallbackFuture
        Adds a callback to run on failure from the thread that executed the computation. If the computation has already been completed exceptionally, the callback runs immediately on the thread calling this method. The callback should not block or be time-consuming to execute because all other callbacks added before execution or being added during execution could be delayed. Exceptions thrown from the callback will be printed to System.err, but will not affect execution of other callbacks.
        Specified by:
        addFailureCallback in interface StealingCallbackFuture<V>
        Parameters:
        onFailure - The callback to run on failure, providing the linked StealingCallbackExecutor and the value of the Throwable that caused the failure.
